author: _shemnon
content: I should have a better explainer up, but i've been heads down getting it at least full loop, then other issues got in the way.  It impacts disk storage size.  No intermediate hashes outside the current block are stored and we use rollback logs to work with re-orgs.  These rollback logs have the potential to drive witness style trace executions (without the actual, you know, witness proof) but the besu team is still finishing that part of the project before the db format is finalized.

author: _shemnon
content: The disc impacts are >10x total size for a full sync, much less for an initial fast sync.  Disc growth rates are much more sustainable than besu's old full-forest technique.

author: _shemnon
content: There is also a 30% or so performance increase at mainnet scale for block processing.  Not the original design intent but to a degree an expected improvement as a side effect of disc storage size and table partitioning.
